verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the \sc Lord\sc*, saying,
Thus speaketh the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

For lo, the days come, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
And these \add are\add* the words that the \sc Lord\sc* spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; We have heard a voice of trembling, Of fear, and not of peace.
Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? Wherefore do I see every man \add with\add* his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, And all faces are turned into paleness?
Alas! for that day \add is\add* great, so that none \add is\add* like it: It \add is\add* even the time of Jacob’s trouble; But he shall be saved out of it.

For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, \add That\add* I will break his yoke from off thy neck, And will burst thy bonds, And strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
But they shall serve the \sc Lord\sc* their God, And David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Neither be dismayed, O Israel: For lo, I \add will\add* save thee from afar, And thy seed from the land of their captivity; And Jacob shall return, And shall be in rest, and be quiet, And none shall make \add him\add* afraid.

For I \add am\add* with thee, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, to save thee: Though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, Yet will I not make a full end of thee: But I will correct thee in measure, And will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Thy bruise \add is\add* incurable, \add And\add* thy wound \add is\add* grievous.
\add There is\add* none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: Thou hast no healing medicines.

All thy lovers have forgotten thee; They seek thee not; For I have wounded thee \add with\add* the wound of an enemy, \add with\add* the chastisement of a cruel one, For the multitude of thine iniquity; \add Because\add* thy sins were increased.
Why criest thou for thine affliction? Thy sorrow \add is\add* incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: \add Because\add* thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.

Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; And all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; And they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, And all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

For I will restore health unto thee, And I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Because they called thee an Outcast, \add saying\add*, This \add is\add* Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*: Behold, I \add will\add* bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, And have mercy on his dwelling places; And the city shall be builded upon her own heap, And the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.
And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: And I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
Their children also shall be as aforetime, And their congregation shall be established before me, And I will punish all that oppress them.

And their nobles shall be of themselves, And their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; And I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: For who \add is\add* this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
Behold, the whirlwind of the \sc Lord\sc* goeth forth \add with\add* fury, A continuing whirlwind: It shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
The fierce anger of the \sc Lord\sc* shall not return, until he have done \add it\add*, And until he have performed the intents of his heart: In the latter days ye shall consider it.
